concept.title: Base ontologies
concept.shortdesc: The ontologies from which the DITA RDF ontology is derived

conbody.p: I have chosen to use the Nepomuk ontologies NIE and NFO, and specialize the classes. The distinction they make between data objects (sequences of bytes) and information elements (interpretations) prevents the confusion between:

ul.li: the file as data on a file system, that has a path and can be moved or renamed
the information contained in this file that results from its interpretation (by an XML editor or a PDF viewer)

conbody.p: For instance, let's consider a DITA topic. If the topic is renamed, can we consider that the topic was modified? The file was modified, but the meaning born by the topic remains untouched.
